slides.title: Welcome to ACCA FA
slides.content:
# Financial Accounting (FA)

FA covers the preparation and understanding of **financial statements**.

## What You Will Learn

- **Double Entry** - Recording transactions
- **Financial Statements** - Preparation
- **Standards** - IAS/IFRS basics
- **Adjustments** - Accruals, prepayments

## Syllabus Areas

| Area | Weight |
|------|--------|
| Recording transactions | 30% |
| Financial statements | 30% |
| Adjustments | 25% |
| Control accounts | 15% |

slides.title: Double Entry Basics
slides.content:
# Double Entry Bookkeeping

## The Accounting Equation

```
Assets = Liabilities + Equity
```

## Debit and Credit Rules

| Type | Debit | Credit |
|------|-------|--------|
| Assets | Increase | Decrease |
| Liabilities | Decrease | Increase |
| Equity | Decrease | Increase |
| Income | Decrease | Increase |
| Expenses | Increase | Decrease |

## Example Entry

```
Purchased goods for cash $1,000:

Dr Purchases    $1,000
Cr Cash         $1,000
```

slides.title: Books of Prime Entry
slides.content:
# Source Documents and Books

## Books of Prime Entry

| Book | Records |
|------|--------|
| Sales Day Book | Credit sales |
| Purchase Day Book | Credit purchases |
| Cash Book | Cash transactions |
| Journal | Non-routine entries |

## Document Flow

```
Source Document
    |
    v
Books of Prime Entry
    |
    v
Ledger Accounts
    |
    v
Trial Balance
    |
    v
Financial Statements
```

## The Ledger

- Sales ledger (debtors)
- Purchase ledger (creditors)
- Nominal ledger (expenses, income)

slides.title: Trial Balance
slides.content:
# Trial Balance

## Purpose

- Check arithmetic accuracy
- Starting point for financial statements
- List all ledger balances

## Format

```
Trial Balance as at 31 Dec
                    Dr      Cr
Capital                   50,000
Sales                    120,000
Purchases          80,000
Wages              25,000
Rent                5,000
Receivables        15,000
Payables                   8,000
Cash                3,000
----------------------------
Total             128,000  128,000
```

## Limitations

- Does not detect all errors
- Compensating errors hidden
- Errors of principle missed

slides.title: Accruals and Prepayments
slides.content:
# Period-End Adjustments

## Accruals

Expenses incurred but not yet paid.

```
Electricity bill for Dec not received:

Dr Electricity expense    500
Cr Accruals               500
```

## Prepayments

Expenses paid in advance.

```
Rent paid covers next 3 months:

Dr Prepayments         1,500
Cr Rent expense        1,500
```

## Income Adjustments

| Type | Treatment |
|------|----------|
| Accrued income | Dr Receivable, Cr Income |
| Deferred income | Dr Income, Cr Liability |

slides.title: Depreciation
slides.content:
# Non-Current Asset Depreciation

## Methods

| Method | Formula |
|--------|--------|
| Straight-line | (Cost - RV) / Life |
| Reducing balance | NBV x Rate% |

## Example: Straight-line

```
Cost: $10,000
Residual Value: $2,000
Life: 4 years

Annual depreciation:
($10,000 - $2,000) / 4 = $2,000
```

## Journal Entry

```
Dr Depreciation expense    2,000
Cr Accumulated depreciation 2,000
```

## Carrying Amount

```
Cost - Accumulated Depreciation
= Carrying Amount (NBV)
```

slides.title: Inventory Valuation
slides.content:
# Inventory

## Valuation Rule (IAS 2)

```
Lower of:
- Cost
- Net Realizable Value (NRV)
```

## Cost Flow Methods

| Method | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| FIFO | First in, first out |
| AVCO | Weighted average |

## Example: FIFO

```
Opening: 100 @ $10
Purchase: 50 @ $12
Sold: 120 units

Cost of sales:
100 x $10 = $1,000
20 x $12 = $240
Total = $1,240
```

## Closing Inventory Entry

```
Dr Inventory (SOFP)  xxx
Cr Purchases (SPL)   xxx
```

slides.title: Irrecoverable Debts
slides.content:
# Bad Debts

## Irrecoverable Debts

Debts that will never be recovered.

```
Dr Irrecoverable debts expense  1,000
Cr Receivables                  1,000
```

## Allowance for Receivables

Estimate of future bad debts.

### Creating Allowance

```
Dr Irrecoverable debts expense  500
Cr Allowance for receivables    500
```

### Increasing Allowance

```
Dr Irrecoverable debts expense  200
Cr Allowance for receivables    200
```

### Decreasing Allowance

```
Dr Allowance for receivables    100
Cr Irrecoverable debts expense  100
```

slides.title: Control Accounts
slides.content:
# Control Accounts

## Purpose

- Verify accuracy of ledgers
- Summary of transactions
- Fraud prevention

## Receivables Control

```
                        Dr      Cr
Opening balance      5,000
Credit sales        20,000
Cash received               18,000
Irrecoverable debts            500
Returns inward              1,000
Closing balance              5,500
                   ------   ------
                   25,000   25,000
```

## Payables Control

```
                        Dr      Cr
Opening balance              3,000
Credit purchases            15,000
Cash paid          12,000
Returns outward     1,500
Closing balance              4,500
                   ------   ------
                   18,000   18,000
```

slides.title: Bank Reconciliation
slides.content:
# Bank Reconciliation

## Why Reconcile?

- Verify cash book accuracy
- Identify timing differences
- Detect errors/fraud

## Common Differences

| Item | Adjustment |
|------|------------|
| Unpresented cheques | Deduct from bank |
| Outstanding deposits | Add to bank |
| Bank charges | Adjust cash book |
| Direct debits | Adjust cash book |

## Format

```
Balance per bank statement    5,000
Add: Outstanding deposits     1,200
Less: Unpresented cheques    (800)
--------------------------------
Balance per cash book         5,400
```

slides.title: Statement of Profit or Loss
slides.content:
# Income Statement

## Format

```
Statement of Profit or Loss
for year ended 31 December

Revenue                    100,000
Cost of sales             (60,000)
-----------------------------
Gross profit               40,000
Distribution costs         (8,000)
Administrative expenses   (12,000)
-----------------------------
Profit before tax          20,000
Income tax expense         (4,000)
-----------------------------
Profit for the year        16,000
```

## Cost of Sales

```
Opening inventory           5,000
Purchases                  55,000
Closing inventory         (10,000)
-----------------------------
Cost of sales              50,000
```

slides.title: Statement of Financial Position
slides.content:
# Balance Sheet

## Format

```
Statement of Financial Position
as at 31 December

Non-current assets
  Property, plant       50,000
  Accumulated depr     (10,000)
                        40,000

Current assets
  Inventory             10,000
  Receivables           15,000
  Cash                   5,000
                        30,000
Total assets            70,000

Equity
  Share capital         30,000
  Retained earnings     25,000
                        55,000

Current liabilities
  Payables              10,000
  Accruals               5,000
                        15,000
Total equity & liab     70,000
```

slides.title: Accounting Concepts
slides.content:
# Fundamental Concepts

## Going Concern

Business will continue operating.

## Accruals Basis

Recognize when earned/incurred, not when cash moves.

## Prudence

Do not overstate assets or income.

## Consistency

Use same methods each period.

## Qualitative Characteristics

| Primary | Enhancing |
|---------|----------|
| Relevance | Comparability |
| Faithful representation | Verifiability |
|  | Timeliness |
|  | Understandability |

slides.title: Errors and Suspense
slides.content:
# Error Correction

## Types of Errors

| Error | Effect |
|-------|--------|
| Omission | Not recorded |
| Commission | Wrong account (same class) |
| Principle | Wrong account type |
| Original entry | Wrong amount |
| Reversal | Dr/Cr swapped |
| Compensating | Errors cancel out |

## Suspense Account

Temporary account to balance trial balance.

```
When trial balance doesn't balance:

Dr/Cr Suspense  xxx

Clear when error found.
```

slides.title: Incomplete Records
slides.content:
# Incomplete Records

## When Records Incomplete

- Small businesses
- Lost records
- No formal system

## Techniques

### Net Assets Approach

```
Closing Net Assets
- Opening Net Assets
+ Drawings
- Capital introduced
= Profit for the year
```

### Mark-up/Margin

```
Mark-up: % on cost
Margin: % on selling price

Cost x (1 + Mark-up%) = Sales
Sales x Margin% = Gross Profit
```

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Congratulations! Summary

You completed **ACCA FA - Financial Accounting**!

## Key Topics

### Recording
- Double entry system
- Books of prime entry
- Control accounts

### Adjustments
- Accruals and prepayments
- Depreciation
- Inventory valuation
- Bad debts

### Statements
- Statement of Profit or Loss
- Statement of Financial Position
- Bank reconciliation

## Key Rules

| Rule | Application |
|------|-------------|
| Lower of cost/NRV | Inventory |
| Matching | Expenses to revenue |
| Going concern | Valuation basis |
